priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Relationship to Subject Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C100130

self.title: CDISC SDTM Relationship to Subject Terminology

definition: The relationship of a person to a study subject.
name: Relationship to Subject
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Relationship to Subject Terminology

terms.definition: A person whose association to an individual is unintentional.
A female relative who is a sibling of either of the biological parents, and who share a common ancestor. (NCI)
A female relative who is a sibling of the biological mother, and who both share a common ancestor. (NCI)
A female relative who is a sibling of the biological father, and who both share a common ancestor. (NCI)
An individual that shares genetic makeup with another individual.
An individual that does not share any genetic makeup with another individual.
A male who shares with his sibling the genetic makeup inherited from one or both of their shared biological parents.
A male who shares with his sibling the genetic makeup inherited from only the biological mother.
terms.preferredTerm: Half-brother with Mother as Common Parent
synonyms: Half-brother with Mother as Common Parent

terms.definition: A male who shares with his sibling the genetic makeup inherited from only the biological father.
terms.preferredTerm: Half-brother with Father as Common Parent
synonyms: Half-brother with Father as Common Parent

terms.definition: A male who shares with his sibling the genetic makeup inherited from both of the biological parents.
A male who shares with his sibling the genetic makeup inherited from only one of the biological parents.
The primary person in charge of the care of a patient, usually a family member or a designated health care professional. (NCI)

A biological or non-biological first generation offspring, including but not limited to biological children (including those born outside of marriage), adopted children, step children, and foster children. (NCI)
A son or daughter with genetic makeup inherited from the parent.
An individual, such as a physician, nurse practitioner or other health care professional, who takes responsibility for a subject's care.
A relative who is the offspring of a sibling of either of the biological parents, and who share a common ancestor. (NCI)
A relative who is the offspring of a sibling of the biological mother and share a common ancestor.
A relative who is the offspring of a sibling of the biological father and share a common ancestor.
A female progeny with genetic makeup inherited from the parent.
Person declares that a domestic partnership relationship exists. (HL7)
One that contributes something. (NCI)
Someone from whom blood is removed for transplantation or other purpose.
Someone from whom one or more kidneys are removed for transplantation or other purpose.
Someone from whom an organ is removed for transplantation or other purpose.
Someone from whom tissue is removed for transplantation or other purpose.
One who instructs or educates others.
Any of the individuals who are descended from a common progenitor, related by marriage or other legal tie.
A male parent.
A male who contributes to the genetic makeup of his offspring through the fertilization of an ovum by his sperm. (NCI)
A male who has acquired children through marriage.
A person whom an individual knows, likes, and trusts. (NCI)
A biological child of an individual's biological child.
A male relative who is the biological father of either the biological mother or the biological father. (NCI)
A male relative who is the biological father of the biological mother. (NCI)
A male relative who is the biological father of the biological father. (NCI)
A female relative who is the biological mother of either the biological mother or the biological father. (NCI)
A female relative who is the biological mother of the biological mother. (NCI)
A female relative who is the biological mother of the biological father. (NCI)
A biological parent of the biological father or biological mother.
A relative who is the biological parent of the biological mother.
A relative who is the biological parent of the biological father.
An individual who is considered part of the social unit comprising one or more individuals living together (all of whom need not be related) in the same dwelling.
A male partner in marriage. (NCI)
A female parent.
A female who contributes to the genetic makeup of her offspring from the fertilization of her ovum. (NCI)
A female who has acquired children through marriage.
A professional healthcare provider who has graduated from a nursing program.
A mother or a father.
An individual who provides support to a pregnant individual.
Any individual related biologically or legally to another individual.
Any biological relative of an individual's biological father.
Any individual related biologically to another individual and considered immediate family as in the case of a parent, sibling or child. (NCI)
Any individual related biologically to another individual and considered one degree removed from the immediate family as in the case of grandparents, aunts and uncles. (NCI)
Any individual related biologically or legally to another individual and considered immediate family as in the case of a spouse, parent, sibling or child.
Any individual related biologically or legally to another individual and residing in the same residence.
Any individual related biologically or legally to another individual and not residing in the same residence.
Any individual related biologically or legally to another individual and considered one degree removed from the immediate family as in the case of in-laws, grandparents, aunts and uncles.
Any individual related biologically or legally to another individual and considered two degrees removed from the immediate family as in the case of cousins.
Any individual with whom the subject attends or attended the same school.
A person with whom one has had sexual relations.
A person's brother or sister.
A person's brother or sister with whom they share a genetic makeup inherited from their shared biological parents.
A person's brother or sister with whom they share a genetic makeup inherited from both of their shared biological parents.
A person's brother or sister with whom they share a genetic makeup inherited from one of their shared biological parents.
A female who shares with her sibling the genetic makeup inherited from one or both of their shared biological parents.
A female who shares with her sibling the genetic makeup inherited from only the biological mother.
terms.preferredTerm: Half-sister with Mother as Common Parent
synonyms: Half-sister with Mother as Common Parent

terms.definition: A female who shares with her sibling the genetic makeup inherited from only the biological father.
terms.preferredTerm: Half-sister with Father as Common Parent
synonyms: Half-sister with Father as Common Parent

terms.definition: A female who shares with her sibling the genetic makeup inherited from both of the biological parents.
A female who shares with her sibling the genetic makeup inherited from only one of the biological parents.
A male progeny with genetic makeup inherited from the parent.
A person's partner in marriage. (NCI)
An individual that is believed likely to have transmitted a disease to another individual.
A person skilled in the performance of the technical or procedural aspects of a profession. (NCI)
Either of two offspring born from the same pregnancy. (NCI)
Either of the two offspring resulting from two separately fertilized ovums during the same pregnancy.
Either of the two offspring resulting from a shared ovum. (NCI)
A male relative who is a sibling of either of the biological parents, and who share a common ancestor. (NCI)
A male relative who is a sibling of the biological mother, and who both share a common ancestor. (NCI)
A male relative who is a sibling of the biological father, and who both share a common ancestor. (NCI)
A female partner in marriage.
